channel.title: Is my computer 'shit'?
channel.description:
Ok according to most people my computer is a piece of shit, so i am wondering.. Is it really?
- WRONG SECTION- Move pl0x? ------------------ System Information ------------------ Operating System: Windows XP Home Edition (5.1, Build 2600) Service Pack 3 (2600.xpsp_sp3_gdr.080814-1236) Language: English (Regional Setting: English) System Manufacturer: Compaq Presario 061 System Model: ED861AA-ABA SR1603WM NA540 BIOS: Phoenix - Award BIOS v6.00PG Processor: AMD Sempron(tm) Processor 3200+, MMX, 3DNow, ~2.8GHz Memory: 5.6GB RAM Page File: 398MB used, 54GB available Windows Dir: C:\WINDOWS DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0c (4.09.0000.0904)
--------------- Display Devices --------------- Card name: ATI RADEON XPRESS 200 Series Manufacturer: ATI Technologies Inc. Chip type: ATI RADEON XPRESS 200 Series (0x5954) DAC type: Internal DAC(400MHz) Device Key: Enum\PCI\VEN_1002&DEV_5954&SUBSYS_2A26103C&REV_00 Display Memory: 810.0 MB Current Mode: 1024 x 768 (32 bit) (75Hz) Monitor: hp pavilion mx70 Monitor Max Res: 1280,1024 Driver Name: ati2dvag.dll Driver Version: 6.14.0010.6553 (English) DDI Version: 9 (or higher) Driver Attributes: Final Retail Driver Date/Size: 6/7/2005 23:44:56, 815460 bytes WHQL Logo'd: Yes WHQL Date Stamp: n/a VDD: n/a Mini VDD: ati2mtag.sys Mini VDD Date: 6/7/2005 23:44:36, 1235968 bytes Device Identifier: {D7B71EE2-1A14-11CF-156A-2C0AA1C2CB35} Vendor ID: 0x1002 Device ID: 0x5954 SubSys ID: 0x2A26103C Revision ID: 0x0000 Revision ID: 0x0000 Video Accel: ModeMPEG2_C ModeMPEG2_D Deinterlace Caps: {6E8329FF-B642-418B-BCF0-BCB6591E255F}: Format(In/Out)=(YUY2,YUY2) Frames(Prev/Fwd/Back)=(0,0,1) Caps=VideoProcess_YUV2RGB VideoProcess_StretchX VideoProcess_StretchY DeinterlaceTech_PixelAdaptive {335AA36E-7884-43A4-9C91-7F87FAF3E37E}: Format(In/Out)=(YUY2,YUY2) Frames(Prev/Fwd/Back)=(0,0,0) Caps=VideoProcess_YUV2RGB VideoProcess_StretchX VideoProcess_StretchY DeinterlaceTech_BOBVerticalStretch {552C0DAD-CCBC-420B-83C8-74943CF9F1A6}: Format(In/Out)=(NV12,0x3231564e) Frames(Prev/Fwd/Back)=(0,0,2) Caps=VideoProcess_YUV2RGB VideoProcess_StretchX VideoProcess_StretchY DeinterlaceTech_PixelAdaptive {6E8329FF-B642-418B-BCF0-BCB6591E255F}: Format(In/Out)=(NV12,0x3231564e) Frames(Prev/Fwd/Back)=(0,0,1) Caps=VideoProcess_YUV2RGB VideoProcess_StretchX VideoProcess_StretchY DeinterlaceTech_PixelAdaptive {335AA36E-7884-43A4-9C91-7F87FAF3E37E}: Format(In/Out)=(NV12,0x3231564e) Frames(Prev/Fwd/Back)=(0,0,0) Caps=VideoProcess_YUV2RGB VideoProcess_StretchX VideoProcess_StretchY DeinterlaceTech_BOBVerticalStretch Registry: OK
So what do you guys think?

item.title: Is my computer 'shit'?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Ps all the people saying you need 64bit to use more than 4gb ram are whores who believe MS’s excuses for their inadequacy.

Read full topic

item.title: Is my computer 'shit'?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:27, topic:252751”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=333877.msg2601358#msg2601358 date=1230248867]

5,6GB ram is shit???
what?

Yes, because he’s running a 32bit OS, which can use a maximum of around 3gb.

Basically he’s got around 2.6gb of ram being wasted.

Add that to an average processor and you’ve got a computer which is nowhere near meeting it’s potential. A few upgrades and that could be a nice machine, in it’s current state I agree though, it’s practically useless.

Windows Server 2003 32-bit edition can have up ti 64GB ram.

Learn to read moron, does it looks like he’s running Widows server? or were you trying to come out with a prove your wrong post that went horribly wrong?
[/quote]

I am just stating that a 32-bit OS can support more than 3gb ram.[/quote]

I said he’s using a 32bit OS, which can run a maximum of 3gb RAM… so how is your point even relevant?

Of course a 32 bit OS can run more than 3gb RAM, you think I’m retarded? XP though, cannot.

Read full topic

item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

what program did you use to pull that data off your computer? I don’t think you typed all that in

item.title: Is my computer 'shit'?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

WoW is “high level of 3D modeling” ?

I’m pretty sure these days you can buy motherboards that have an nvidia chipset built in, with integrated graphics that can run WoW in medium settings and get a smooth 60+ fps, on a 100$ board.

As for ATI sucking, they don’t. Just because you have an old card thats ATI, and its obviously shit compared to newer cards, don’t blame the company. ATI/AMD + nvidia are pretty much equal.

Read full topic

item.title: Is my computer 'shit'?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

the fu superior:

i only have 1.25gb of ram. and my graphics card is shit. WoW looks like crap, but atleast it can run it.

Rub it in.

I don’t want to play WoW, my friend was trying to convince me to play it, so I was going to try the trial.
But, oh no, my graphics card can’t do that high level of 3D modeling.

Read full topic
